    Class: GraphDatabase

    Defined in: lib/GraphDatabase._coffee

    Overview

    The class corresponding to a Neo4j graph database. Start here.

    Instance Method Summary

    • - (void) constructor(url) Constructor Construct a new client for the Neo4j graph database available at the given (root) URL.
    • - (Number) getVersion(_) Fetch and "return" (via callback) the Neo4j version as a float.
    • - (Node) createNode(data) Create and immediately return a new, unsaved node with the given properties.
    • - (Node) getNode(url, _) Fetch and "return" (via callback) the node at the given URL.
    • - (Node) getIndexedNode(index, property, value, _) Fetch and "return" (via callback) the node indexed under the given property and value in the given index.
    • - (Array<Node>) getIndexedNodes(index, property, value, _) Fetch and "return" (via callback) the nodes indexed under the given property and value in the given index.
    • - (Node) getNodeById(id, _) Fetch and "return" (via callback) the node with the given Neo4j ID.
    • - (Relationship) getRelationship(url, _) Fetch and "return" (via callback) the relationship at the given URL.
    • - (Relationship) getIndexedRelationship(index, property, value, _) Fetch and "return" (via callback) the relationship indexed under the given property and value in the given index.
    • - (Array<Relationship>) getIndexedRelationships(index, property, value, _) Fetch and "return" (via callback) the relationships indexed under the given property and value in the given index.
    • - (Relationship) getRelationshipById(id, _) Fetch and "return" (via callback) the relationship with the given Neo4j ID.
    • - (void) query(query, params, _) Fetch and "return" (via callback) the results of the given {http://docs.neo4j.org/chunked/stable/cypher-query-lang.html Cypher} query, optionally passing the given query parameters (recommended to avoid Cypher injection security vulnerabilities).

    Constructor Details

    - (void) constructor(url)

    Construct a new client for the Neo4j graph database available at the
    given (root) URL.

    'http://user:password@example.com/'.

    Parameters:

    • url (String) — The (root) URL where the Neo4j graph database is available, e.g. 'http://localhost:7474/'. This URL should include HTTP Basic Authentication info if needed, e.g.

    Instance Method Details

    Note: This doesn't preserve "milestone" information, e.g. "M06".

    Fetch and "return" (via callback) the Neo4j version as a float.

    Parameters:

    • callback (Function)

    Returns:

    • Number

    - (Node) createNode(data)

    Note: This node will not be persisted to the database until and unless its save() method is called.

    Create and immediately return a new, unsaved node with the given
    properties.

    Parameters:

    • data (Object) — The properties this new node should have.

    Returns:

    • Node

    - (Node) getNode(url, _)

    TODO: Should this indeed throw an error if no node exists at this URL? Or should we be returning undefined?

    Fetch and "return" (via callback) the node at the given URL.
    Throws an error if no node exists at this URL.

    Parameters:

    • url (String)
    • callback (Function)

    Returns:

    • Node

    - (Node) getIndexedNode(index, property, value, _)

    Note: With this method, at most one node is returned. See

    Fetch and "return" (via callback) the node indexed under the given
    property and value in the given index. If none exists, returns
    undefined.

    #getIndexedNodes for returning multiple nodes.

    Parameters:

    • index (String) — The name of the index, e.g. 'node_auto_index'.
    • property (String) — The name of the property, e.g. 'username'.
    • value (Object) — The value of the property, e.g. 'aseemk'.
    • callback (Function)

    Returns:

    • Node

    - (Array<Node>) getIndexedNodes(index, property, value, _)

    Note: This method will return multiple nodes if there are multiple hits. See #getIndexedNode for returning at most one node.

    Fetch and "return" (via callback) the nodes indexed under the given
    property and value in the given index. If no such nodes exist, an
    empty array is returned.

    Parameters:

    • index (String) — The name of the index, e.g. 'node_auto_index'.
    • property (String) — The name of the property, e.g. 'platform'.
    • value (Object) — The value of the property, e.g. 'xbox'.
    • callback (Function)

    Returns:

    • Array<Node>

    - (Node) getNodeById(id, _)

    TODO: Should this indeed throw an error if no node exists with this ID? Or should we be returning undefined?

    Fetch and "return" (via callback) the node with the given Neo4j ID.
    Throws an error if no node exists with this ID.

    Parameters:

    • id (Number) — The integer ID of the node, e.g. 1234.
    • callback (Function)

    Returns:

    • Node

    TODO: Should this indeed throw an error if no relationship exists at this URL? Or should we be returning undefined?

    Throws an error if no relationship exists at this URL.

    Parameters:

    • url (String)
    • callback (Function)

    Returns:

    - (Relationship) getIndexedRelationship(index, property, value, _)

    Note: With this method, at most one relationship is returned. See

    Fetch and "return" (via callback) the relationship indexed under the
    given property and value in the given index. If none exists, returns
    undefined.

    #getIndexedRelationships for returning multiple relationships.

    Parameters:

    • index (String) — The name of the index, e.g. 'relationship_auto_index'.
    • property (String) — The name of the property, e.g. 'created'.
    • value (Object) — The value of the property, e.g. 1346713658393.
    • callback (Function)

    Returns:

    • Relationship

    - (Array<Relationship>) getIndexedRelationships(index, property, value, _)

    Note: This method will return multiple relationships if there are multiple hits. See #getIndexedRelationship for returning at most one relationship.

    Fetch and "return" (via callback) the relationships indexed under the
    given property and value in the given index. If no such relationships
    exist, an empty array is returned.

    Parameters:

    • index (String) — The name of the index, e.g. 'relationship_auto_index'.
    • property (String) — The name of the property, e.g. 'favorite'.
    • value (Object) — The value of the property, e.g. true.
    • callback (Function)

    Returns:

    • Array<Relationship>

    - (Relationship) getRelationshipById(id, _)

    TODO: Should this indeed throw an error if no relationship exists with this ID? Or should we be returning undefined?

    Fetch and "return" (via callback) the relationship with the given Neo4j
    ID. Throws an error if no relationship exists with this ID.

    Parameters:

    • id (Number) — The integer ID of the relationship, e.g. 1234.
    • callback (Function)

    Returns:

    • Relationship

    - (Array<Object>) query(query, callback)
    - (Array<Object>) query(query, params, callback)

    Fetch and "return" (via callback) the results of the given
    {http://docs.neo4j.org/chunked/stable/cypher-query-lang.html Cypher}
    query, optionally passing the given query parameters (recommended to
    avoid Cypher injection security vulnerabilities). The returned results
    are an array of "rows" (matches), where each row is a map from key name
    (as given in the query) to value. Any values that represent nodes or
    relationships are returned as Node and Relationship instances.

    Overloads:

    - (Array<Object>) query(query, callback)

    Parameters:

    • query (String) — The Cypher query. Can be multi-line.
    • callback (Function)

    Returns:

    • Array<Object>

    - (Array<Object>) query(query, params, callback)

    Parameters:

    • query (String) — The Cypher query. Can be multi-line.
    • params (Object) — A map of parameters for the Cypher query.
    • callback (Function)

    Returns:

    • Array<Object>
